abstract: Apple says customers have downloaded two billion applications for the iPhone and iPod Touch.
snippet: Apple says customers have downloaded two billion applications for the iPhone and iPod Touch.
lead_paragraph: A quick update from the land of Apple: The company announced on Monday another set of remarkable numbers for the app store for the iPhone and iPod Touch. Customers have downloaded more than two billion apps in the last year and a half, up from a billion in April and a billion and a half in July. Apple says there are now 85,000 apps available for the phone, up from 65,000 in July.

headline.main: Apple App Store Crosses Another Threshold

abstract: Michael Tchao, one of the key figures behind Apple’s Newton tablet computer, has returned to the company after 15 years.
snippet: Michael Tchao, one of the key figures behind Apple’s Newton tablet computer, has returned to the company after 15 years.
lead_paragraph: If you were gearing up to launch a tablet computer — and these days, who isn’t? — who would you hire to market it? One obvious candidate would be Michael Tchao, one of the original developers of Apple‘s groundbreaking but failed Newton personal digital assistant.

headline.main: Apple Rehires a Developer of Its Newton Tablet
